page.title: 14CLAYPOLE'S PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The primary school is on School Lane and the first part was built in 1863. Several years later the rest was added. At present there are 64 pupils on roll coming from Claypole, Stubton, Fenton and Dry Doddington. A school bus, hired by Lincolnshire County Council, caters for those children living outside Claypole. The school is a Church of England Controlled one. It has links with the local church especially at Harvest Festival and St. Peter's Day when the children take their service to the church. Mr M. Kimberley is the current Head Master and he has two full time teaching staff, Mrs L. Knott the Deputy Head and Mrs M. Holmes. A second village hall, shared by the school and the village is nearby.
